stepItems.step: Break kelp into smaller strips to fit in stew bags if necessary
Place all stew ingredients (anchovies, radish, kelp) into bags (optional) then into pot of water
Boil all ingredients for at least 30 minutes then simmer at low heat for at least 10 minutes

Cut the following:
- Cut kimchi into ~1" pieces
- Thin slice green onion and separate white from green
- Slice onion into 1/4" - 1/2" strips
- Mince garlic
- Slice pork belly into 1/4" - 1/2" pieces
- Cut tofu into 1.5" x 1.5" x 0.5" pieces
Combine dry ingredients (sugar, salt, hot pepper flakes)
Combine wet ingredients (kimchi brine, hot pepper paste, sesame oil)
Fry pork belly pieces over medium heat (it doesn't have to be fully cooked since it'll cook in the stew). Place it to the side
Put instant pot in saute mode (or heat up a normal large pot) and throw in oil, onion, garlic, and the whites of the green onion. Stir for about 5 minutes (onion should not be browned)
Add kimchi, mostly-cooked pork belly, dry ingredients, wet ingredients, and broth into the instant pot
Mix to combine all of the ingredients. Let the flavors get to know each other
All that should be left is the tofu. After ingredients have been combined, add the tofu in
Turn the instant pot on manual for 20 minutes on high pressure or simmer over stove with lid slightly ajar for at least 40 minutes and up to 2 hours

foodItems.item: 1 lb kimchi (about half a thin tall 14 oz. jar)
4 tsp gochugaru (Korean hot pepper flakes) (can adjust to spicy level)
around 4 cups anchovy broth (see below for stock ingredients or buy broth)
1/3 cup asian (korean or daikon) radish (about 2-4 inches of radish)
